body_html:
I don't think there's anything besides the test code and the regular FeatureColumn guide. But even that guide is missing some good end to end examples... this StackOverflow question has a good example of using the FeatureColumn API to construct an input layer. The sequence case would be quite similar except swapping input_layer for sequence_input_layer and using the sequence FeatureColumns.

You might also find the code and tests for the relatively new RNNEstimator to be helpful.
body_text:
I don't think there's anything besides the test code and the regular FeatureColumn guide. But even that guide is missing some good end to end examples... this StackOverflow question has a good example of using the FeatureColumn API to construct an input layer. The sequence case would be quite similar except swapping input_layer for sequence_input_layer and using the sequence FeatureColumns.
You might also find the code and tests for the relatively new RNNEstimator to be helpful.
body:
I don't think there's anything besides the test code and the [regular FeatureColumn guide](https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/feature_columns). But even that guide is missing some good end to end examples... [this StackOverflow question ](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47523374/feature-columns-embedding-lookup)has a good example of using the FeatureColumn API to construct an input layer. The sequence case would be quite similar except swapping input_layer for sequence_input_layer and using the sequence FeatureColumns.

You might also find the code and tests for the relatively new [RNNEstimator](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/estimator/python/estimator/rnn.py) to be helpful.
